core.map

Class MapController

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.map.MapController

  • public class MapController
extends java.lang.Object
    MapController controls all operations on a single holden Map instance.

    MapController is able to generate new Map instances of certain types and is able to build a Map instance by a file using the MapFactory. The new Map instance becomes the controlled one.

    MapController is able to modify the holden Map instance.

    MapController is able to choose different map moving rules by defining allowed and forbidden movements on a grid by MovingRuleStrategy.

    MapController is able to choose different heuristic functions to estimate the distance of two points on a grid by HeuristicStrategy.

    MapController is able to find the shortest path on the holden Map instance considering a chosen moving rule and heuristic with a preselected algorithm. For some selected algorithms a preprocessing is required.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Loka
    See Also:
    Map, MapFactory, ShortestPathStrategy, MovingRuleStrategy, HeuristicStrategy

        Returns:

      • switchPassable

        public void switchPassable(Vector coordinate)
                    throws InvalidCoordinateException
        Switches the passable state on the controlled Map instance of a given point. After running this method, a given passable field on the controlled Map instance becomes unpassable and an given unpassable field becomes passable.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - Point where passable state should be switched.
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException - Thrown if coordinate is no Point on the controlled Map instance.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Map

      • saveMap

        public void saveMap(java.io.File file)
        Saves the current state of the controlled Map instance as .map file.
        Parameters:
        file - filename of the file the map should be saved. To generate a valid file it should be type .map.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Map

      • setAllNeighborMovingRule

        public void setAllNeighborMovingRule()
        Sets new used movements rules: AllNeighbor.

        All orthogonal and diagonal movements are allowed as long as the reached point is passable.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        AllNeighborMovingRule, MovingRuleStrategy

      • setUncutNeighborMovingRule

        public void setUncutNeighborMovingRule()
        Sets new used movements rules: UncutNeighbor.

        All orthogonal movements are allowed as long as the reached point is passable. All diagonal movements are allowed as long as the reached point is passable and no obstacle is cut.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        UncutNeighborMovingRule, MovingRuleStrategy

      • setOrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

        public void setOrthogonalNeighborMovingRule()
        Sets new used movements rules: OrthogonalNeighbor.

        All orthogonal movements are allowed as long as the reached point is passable. All diagonal movements are forbidden.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule, MovingRuleStrategy

      • setZeroHeuristic

        public void setZeroHeuristic()
        Sets new used heuristic function to estimate the distance of two points on a grid: ZeroHeuristic.

        Estimated the distance between two points on a grid is constant 0.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ZeroHeuristic, HeuristicStrategy

      • setManhattanHeuristic

        public void setManhattanHeuristic()
        Sets new used heuristic function to estimate the distance of two points on a grid: ManhattanHeuristic.

        Estimates the distance between two points on a grid by calculating the manhattan distance.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ManhattanHeuristic, HeuristicStrategy

      • setGridHeuristic

        public void setGridHeuristic()
        Sets new used heuristic function to estimate the distance of two points on a grid: GridHeuristic.

        Estimates the distance between two points on a grid by calculating the distance on a grid without obstacles (diagonal movements allowed)
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        GridHeuristic, HeuristicStrategy

      • setEuclideanHeuristic

        public void setEuclideanHeuristic()
        Sets new used heuristic function to estimate the distance of two points on a grid: .

        Estimates the distance between two points on a grid by calculating the euclidean distance.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        EuclideanHeuristic, HeuristicStrategy

      • setAStarShortestPath

        public void setAStarShortestPath()
        Sets new used function to find the shortest path between two paints on a grid with passable and non passable points: AStar.

        Uses AStar strategy only.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        AStarShortestPath, ShortestPathStrategy

      • setJPSShortestPath

        public void setJPSShortestPath()
        Sets new used function to find the shortest path between two paints on a grid with passable and non passable points: Jump Point Search.

        Uses JPS strategy only.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        JPSShortestPath, ShortestPathStrategy

      • setJPSPlusShortestPath

        public void setJPSPlusShortestPath()
        Sets new used function to find the shortest path between two paints on a grid with passable and non passable points: JPS+.

        Uses JPS lookup strategy and JPS bounding boxes as pruning strategy.

        Preprocessing required: Calculates all jump points by JPS strategy and save them in a look up table to use it to find the shortest path without exploring the map in runtime.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        PreCalculatedShortestPath, JPSPreCalculationShortestPathPreprocessing, ShortestPathStrategy

      • setJPSPlusBBShortestPath

        public void setJPSPlusBBShortestPath()
        Sets new used function to find the shortest path between two paints on a grid with passable and non passable points: JPS+BB.

        Uses JPS lookup table strategy and JPS bounding boxes as pruning strategy.

        Preprocessing required: Calculates all jump points by JPS strategy and save them in a look up table to use it to find the shortest path without exploring the map in runtime. Calculates bounding boxes by JPS strategy to estimate whether a specific point is on the shortest path between start and goal for pruning if not.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        PreCalculatedShortestPath, JPSPreCalculationShortestPathPreprocessing, JPSBoundingBoxesShortestPathPruning, ShortestPathStrategy

      • setAStarBBShortestPath

        public void setAStarBBShortestPath()
        Sets new used function to find the shortest path between two paints on a grid with passable and non passable points: AStarBB.

        Uses AStar strategy and AStar bounding boxes as pruning strategy.

        Preprocessing required: Calculates bounding boxes by AStar strategy to estimate whether a specific point is on the shortest path between start and goal for pruning if not.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        AStarShortestPath, AStarBoundingBoxesShortestPathPruning, ShortestPathStrategy

      • setJPSBBShortestPath

        public void setJPSBBShortestPath()
        Sets new used function to find the shortest path between two paints on a grid with passable and non passable points: JPSBB.

        Uses JPS strategy and JPS bounding boxes as pruning strategy.

        Preprocessing required: Calculates bounding boxes by JPS strategy to estimate whether a specific point is on the shortest path between start and goal for pruning if not.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        JPSShortestPath, JPSBoundingBoxesShortestPathPruning, ShortestPathStrategy

      • preprocessShortestPath

        public long preprocessShortestPath()
        Does needed preprocessing considering the selected shortest path strategy and the selected moving rule.
        Returns:
        time needed for preprocessing in milliseconds
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ShortestPathStrategy, ShortestPath, ShortestPathPreprocessing

      • runShortstPath

        public Tuple2<ShortestPathResult,java.lang.Long> runShortstPath(Vector start,
                                                                Vector goal)
                                                         throws NoPathFoundException
        Searches the shortest path from start to goal considering the selected shortest path strategy, the proprocessing data, the selected moving rule and the selected heuristic.
        Parameters:
        start - point on map to start
        goal - point on map to reach
        Returns:
        Throws:
        NoPathFoundException - Thrown, if goal is not reachable from start point or if start or goal are nonpassable.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ShortestPathStrategy, ShortestPath, ShortestPathResult
